name: Google (AI & Infrastructure)
title: Project EAT — AI Infrastructure Consolidation

classification.classificationRationale: Consolidation of previously separate teams (Google Research, Cloud, hardware) into single 'AI and Infrastructure' (AI2) unit under Amin Vahdat. Hub-and-spoke: AI2 as central hub consolidating chip development, AI infrastructure, and developer tools. Low confidence — based on leaked memo, limited detail on actual org structure.

description: Project EAT is a comprehensive reorganization of Google's AI infrastructure, chip development, and developer tools inside the 'AI and Infrastructure' (AI2) unit. Led by Amin Vahdat, the project consolidates teams from Google Research, Cloud, and hardware divisions. Goals include competitive TPUs, consolidated AI teams, and a wholesale rethinking of Google's AI technology stack. Leaked memo dated Jan 30, 2026. Note: This specimen covers Google's AI infrastructure organization, separate from DeepMind and Google X specimens.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: AI2 unit led by Amin Vahdat. Consolidates teams from Google Research, Cloud, and hardware.

layers.label: Project EAT Leaked
layers.summary: Leaked memo reveals Project EAT: comprehensive reorganization of AI infrastructure, chip development, and developer tools inside AI2 unit under Amin Vahdat. Consolidates teams from Google Research, Cloud, and hardware. Described as 'wholesale rethinking of Google's AI technology stack.'

openQuestions: How does AI2 relate to DeepMind organizationally? Are there overlapping mandates?
What specific teams were consolidated and what was the previous reporting structure?
How does Project EAT affect Google Cloud's AI offerings vs. internal infrastructure?
What is the TPU competitiveness timeline vs. NVIDIA?
